meanings.definition: The heading at the top of a letter, typically including the sender's name and address.
meanings.sent1: The letterheads on official documents make them look professional.
meanings.sent2: I always make sure to include my letterheads when sending out business letters.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a clue on the letterheads that led to solving the case.
meanings.sent4: Her letterheads were like a beacon, guiding the reader to the important information.
meanings.sent5: The bright red letterheads stood out against the white paper, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A printed sheet of paper with a company's name and logo, used for official correspondence.
meanings.sent1: The company's letterheads featured a sleek design that represented their brand well.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to always use the official letterheads for any business communication.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat decided to play with the stack of letterheads, causing chaos in the office.
meanings.sent4: The letterheads acted as ambassadors for the company, leaving a lasting impression on clients.
meanings.sent5: The letterheads were so well-designed that they became collectors' items among graphic designers.

meanings.definition: A person who heads or leads a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: As the letterheads of the team, they were responsible for making important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The letterheads of the organization met to discuss the upcoming charity event.
meanings.sent3: The letterheads of the club had to deal with a sudden influx of new members.
meanings.sent4: She was the letterheads of the committee, guiding them towards their goals.
meanings.sent5: The letterheads of the company were known for their strong leadership and vision.
